Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Dan is an exemplary teaching fellow.  He was extremely well prepared, knowledgeable, engaged, accessible and had a contagious interest in the material he was teaching.  He provided a great supplement to Professor Hardy's lectures.  Also, I've never had a TF who structured the time of sections better than Dan did; there was a substantial supplemental lesson and real coverage of material each session.  He'll make a wonderful professor, I'm sure.
One of the best teacher's I've had in my time here. Not just brilliant, but a good instructor and successful at engaging the students.

I appreciated how Daniel took time to help us think critically as historians, synthesize course lecture and reading materials, expand our resting list as desired, and keep both a broad and specific view of each weeks' themes.
Daniel was great. He was clear in what we were talking about and illuminated the topics well. He also was easy to reach out to if need and gave clear feedback.

Strengths
Knowledgeable, friendly, energetic, engaged with the students - interested in the material, pressing hard for us to consider the issues in depth

Weaknesses
Sometimes the discussion in section felt like a guessing game - Mr. Bohac had something in mind that he wanted us to say, and we were all guessing what it was - which felt slightly unproductive for a graduate school discussion section.
Very well-informed and structured sections thoughtfully

Dan was absolutely, absolutely fantastic. I cannot say enough about him.  Whereas I didn't get a ton out of this class in lecture, I got SO MUCH, I got EVERYTHING, out of his section. He tied all our readings together and pointed out bigger historical trends in them in ways that were tangible and exciting. He was great at stimulating conversation and monitoring discussion, and led us towards a climax in each class with amazing pointed questions. I swear, every time I was in his section, I felt as if I was in an episode of National Treasure, and he was Nicholas Cage leading us all, through the power of suggestion, into an unbelievable realization about things we hadn't even realized were behind the  texts!

He is so knowledgeable but also incredibly energetic. He is so good at what he does and clearly was born to be an educator, in my opinion.

Daniel was awesome. I can't think of a weakness honestly. He is helpful and sraightforward. He really opened up the text in section and showed us the dynamics underneath in a way that was really informative and interesting. He is friendly and a natural leader. I really enjoyed section with him. It was one of my favorite weekly meetings.

I did not have Daniel as a section leader. However, I found him personable, kind, diligent, and helpful with questions. 
 I believe he served the class well.
